dataset.title: Biomass of plant species of Orgovány LTER grasslands (KISKUN LTER)

section.para: The aim of the yearly biomass measurements in the grasslands is to study the effect of weather to the plant production along a productivity gradient. Aboveground living plant biomass data from 24-30 grassland patches in Orgovány region of Kiskunság (Kiskunság National Park) along a productivity gradient from open sand grassland to reedbed, yearly from 2003 to 2012, were sampled approx. at the time of maximum aboveground biomass. The size of the patches are 20 to 50 sq-m, and each year one 0.5 by 0.5 m sampling unit is selected within each patch. The patches are permanent ones; some of them were omitted and replaced because of disturbance in several years. The total aboveground living plant biomass and LAI data are submitted in HU_SI001199_lai_biomass_20130508 dataset, and the EUNIS habitat types of the sampled patches are submitted in HU_SI001199_eunis_habitat_type_20130508 dataset.

online.onlineDescription: Plant species biomass data from Orgovány LTER grasslands

para.literalLayout: Biomass in grasslands was measured by harvesting all herbs and plant material over a small parcel of 0.25 m2. In mown grassland, sampling was made right before mowing. Otherwise, the sampling was made approx.at the time of the maximum LAI. As much as possible, clipping was made right at the level of the ground. All plant material was dried at 60⁰C until constant weight.From the dried material three fractions were separated: (1) plant material which was dead in the time of clipping, (2) non-photosynthesising living material, and (3) photosynthesising material.Biomass species was calculated by summing up the dry weight of all living material belong to a species, and expressed in grams / m2.

section.para: The sample were taken in grasslands of Orgovány LTER site of KISKUN LTER. The data are considered to be representative for the grasslands of KISKUN LTER. Aboveground living plant biomass and LAI data from 24-30 grassland patches in Orgovány region of Kiskunság (Kiskunság National Park) along a productivity gradient from open sand grassland to reedbed, yearly from 2003 to 2012, were sampled approx. at the time of maximum aboveground biomass. The size of the patches are 20 to 50 sq-m, and each year one 0.5 by 0.5 m sampling unit is selected within each patch. The patches are permanent ones; some of them were omitted and replaced because of disturbance in several years. The aboveground living plant biomass data of separate species are submitted in HU_SI001199_species_biomass_20130508 dataset, and the EUNIS habitat types of the sampled patches are submitted in HU_SI001199_eunis_habitat_type_20130508 dataset.
